description: battle scene with soldiers fighting hand-to-hand at left in middle ground; two soldiers--one fallen--in foreground; Alexander Farnese behind soldiers in foreground, standing with feet apart, pointing with his PL arm; soldiers wear draping garments and helmets with plumes; buildings at right; additional armies in far distance, UL; mounted to ivory sheet with attached green border
inscription:
Inscription and mark

LR, in pen and brown ink: [L Carrache.]
markings: Mount watermark: double-headed eagle, similar to Heawood 1322 but with two crowns
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk; laid down on mount
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 4, 1993, no. 117, as Bolognese school for Â£2,700, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1993-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Alexander Farnese Directing the Siege of Antwerp
